title: File Taxes Help Animals
subtitle: A pro bono marketing campaign for the MassAnimalFund

paragraphs: There’s an ongoing program with animal homelessness in Massachusetts. On October 31, 2012, a law took effect that, in part, created the Homeless Animal Prevention and Care Fund (Massachusetts Animal Fund). The Fund is administered by the Massachusetts Department of Agricultural Resources with assistance from an advisory committee and seeks to end the problem of animal homelessness in Massachusetts. This program is solely funded by the voluntary tax check-off (Line 33f) on the Massachusetts resident income tax form and by monetary donations. — Mass Animal Fund

To assist in the fundraising and elevate awareness of the campaign I created a series of graphics for digital billboard display and the social media promotions. The billboards were displayed for 4 month straight before and during the tax season across the state at ~100 MassDOT PSA locations.
In 2016, Massachusetts taxpayers donated $291,000 on the line 32F of the state tax form. The social media campaign content received 1.5 million impressions.
